item1_summary:
Our ability to maintain or gain share of sales in the global market or in regional or local markets may be limited as a result of actions by competitors . Competitive pressures may cause the Company and our bottling partners to reduce prices we charge customers . E‑commerce may create additional consumer price deflation by, among other things, facilitating comparison shopping, and could potentially threaten the value of some of our legacy route-to-market strategies .
 Changes in the retail landscape or the loss of key retail or foodservice customers could adversely affect our financial results . Our industry is being affected by the trend toward consolidation in, and the blurring of the lines between, retail channels . In developed markets, discounters and value stores are growing at a rapid pace .
 Our success depends in part on our ability to grow our business in emerging and developing markets, which in turn depends on economic and political conditions in those markets . The loss of one or more of our key retail or foodservice customers could have an adverse effect on our financial performance . We rely on local availability of talented management and employees to establish and manage our operations in these markets .
 If we are unable to successfully manage, we may not be able to recruit new employees . We are concerned about the potential impact on our ability to attract new talent to the world . We want to know if we can find a way to make sure they are ready for the next generation of young people to be ready for work .
 Changes in laws and policies could make it more difficult for us to recruit or relocate specialized technical, professional and management personnel . The unexpected loss of experienced and specialized employees due to an increase in aggressive recruiting for best-in-class talent could deplete our institutional knowledge base and erode our competitiveness . Disruption of our supply chain, including increased commodity, raw material, packaging, energy, transportation and other input costs, may adversely affect our financial condition or results of operations .
 Some of the raw materials and supplies used in the production of our products are available from a limited number of suppliers or from a sole supplier . Some of our suppliers are located in countries experiencing political instability or other risks and/or unfavorable economic conditions . Any sustained or significant disruption to the manufacturing or sourcing of products or materials could increase our costs and interrupt product supply .
 These factors include changes in supply and demand; supplier capacity constraints; a deterioration of our or our bottling partners’ relationships with suppliers; international conflicts; political uncertainties; acts of terrorism; governmental instability; inflation; inflation . Higher product prices may result in reductions in sales volume . Consumers may be less willing to pay a price differential and may increasingly purchase lower-priced offerings, or may forgo some purchases altogether .
 Acquisitions of businesses, brands or bottling operations may involve significant challenges and risks . The expected benefits, including cost and growth synergies associated with such acquisitions, may take longer to realize than expected or may not be realized at all . We have encountered, and may in the future encounter, challenges in successfully integrating acquired businesses, technologies, services, products and systems .
 Our financial performance is impacted by how well we can integrate and manage our acquisitions . We may not be able to achieve our strategic and financial objectives for acquired businesses, brands or bottling operations . We also participate in the sales of other beverage brands through licenses, joint ventures and strategic relationships . If we are unable to successfully manage our relationships with our joint venture partners or our strategic relationships, our financial performance could be adversely affected .
 Our third-party service providers and business partners may not fulfill their respective commitments and responsibilities in a timely manner and in accordance with the agreed-upon terms or applicable laws . If we are unable to renew collective bargaining agreements on satisfactory terms, or if we or our bottling partners experience strikes, work stoppages or labor unrest, our business could suffer .
 Strikes, work stoppages or other forms of labor unrest could impair our ability to supply concentrates and syrups to our bottling operations or our major bottlers’ plants . If we are unable to renew collective bargaining agreements on satisfactory terms, our labor costs could increase, which could affect our profit margins . Obesity and other health-related concerns may reduce demand for some of our products .
 If we don't address evolving consumer product and shopping preferences, our business could suffer . Consumers are concerned about the perceived health effects of, or location of origin of, ingredients, raw materials or substances in our products or packaging . Changes in consumer tastes and needs coupled with rapid expansion of beverage options and delivery methods .
 Product safety and quality concerns could negatively affect our business . Consumer confidence depends in large part on our ability to maintain consumer confidence in the safety of all of our products . We may recall products if they become contaminated or adulterated by any means, or if they are mislabeled or do not meet regulatory requirements .
 Bottling partners and products have been, and could continue to be, subject to inspection by federal, state and local authorities . A widespread product recall could result in significant losses due to the costs of a recall, the destruction of product inventory, and lost sales . A recall could also subject us to product liability claims and negative publicity, which could cause our business to suffer .
 "Risks may be increased if officials make public statements about alleged risks associated with particular ingredients used in our products, or unintentional contaminants that may be present in our food or water supply" If we are not successful in our efforts to digitalize the system, our financial results could be negatively affected . We believe our future success will depend on our ability to adapt to and thrive in the digital environment .
 The Coca-Cola system is trying to digitalize the system by creating more relevant and more personalized experiences . Digitalizing operations through the use of data, artificial intelligence, automation, robotics and digital devices to increase efficiency and productivity . If we are not successful, our ability to increase sales and improve margins may be negatively affected .
 In some emerging markets, the production and sale of counterfeit or “spurious” products may damage the image and reputation of our products . In addition, from time to time we and our executives have engaged, and may in the future engage, in public policy endeavors that are directly related to our products and packaging .
 If we fail to respect our employees’ and our supply chain workers’ human rights, or inadvertently discriminate against any group of employees or hiring prospects, we could face legal risks and/or our ability to hire and retain the best talent will be diminished . If we are unable to successfully manage new product launches, our business and financial results could be adversely affected .
 The success of new and evolved products depends on several factors, including timely and successful product development, adherence to new global and/or local standards of practice, consumer acceptance and stakeholder perception . As we become subject to additional governmental regulations, including alcohol regulations related to licensing, trade and pricing practices, we may become exposed to increased compliance costs and disruptions to our existing business .
 Some of our bottling partners have the right to manufacture or distribute their own products or certain products of other beverage companies . If we are unable to maintain operating and strategic alignment or agree on appropriate pricing and marketing and advertising support, our business and financial results could be affected . Our ability to unilaterally change the prices we charge for our concentrates and syrups may be limited .
 A deterioration of the financial condition or results of operations of one or more of our major bottling partners could adversely affect our net operating revenues from sales of concentrates and syrups . A decrease in our equity income and/or impairments of our equity method investments could also result in a decrease in equity income .
 We are subject to income tax in the United States and numerous other jurisdictions in which we generate profits . Our overall effective income tax rate is a function of applicable local tax rates in the jurisdictions where we operate . The isolated or combined effects of unfavorable movements in tax rates, geographic mix or foreign currency exchange rates could reduce our net income .
 The Company will continue to monitor developments to determine any potential impact in the countries in which we operate . The Company believes our tax estimates are reasonable but the final determination of tax is final determination . It is possible that additional legislative changes may increase uncertainty and have a material impact on our net income and cash flow. Significant judgment is required in determining our annual income tax expense and in evaluating our tax positions.
 The results of audits or related disputes could have a material adverse effect on our financial statements . The results could be materially different from our historical income tax provisions, estimates and accruals . The Company firmly believes that the IRS’ claims are without merit and is pursuing, and will continue to pursue, all available administrative and judicial remedies .
 The IRS could successfully appeal the portions of the Opinions that are favorable to the Company and/or assert new claims for additional tax relating to the subsequent years by broadening the scope to cover additional foreign licensees . These adjustments could have a material adverse impact on the Company’s financial position, results of operations and cash flows .
 Changes in laws and regulations relating to beverage containers and packaging could increase our costs and reduce demand for our products . Increases in or the imposition of new indirect taxes on our business operations or products would increase the cost of products or, to the extent levied directly on consumers, make our products less affordable . We anticipate that similar legislation or regulations may be proposed in the future at federal, state and local levels .
 Regulators in the U.S. and abroad have been expressing concerns about the processing and the use of particular ingredients or additives in beverage products . If these types of requirements become applicable to one or more of our products under current or future environmental or health laws or regulations, they may inhibit sales of such products . For more information regarding Proposition 65, refer to the heading “Governmental Regulation”
 We evaluate litigation claims and legal proceedings to assess the likelihood of unfavorable outcomes . Actual outcomes or losses may differ from our current assessments and estimates . We conduct business in markets with high-risk legal compliance environments, which exposes us to increased legal and reputational risk . Our policies and procedures require strict compliance by our employees and agents with all U.S. and local laws and regulations .
 Failure to adequately protect, or disputes relating to, trademarks, formulas and other intellectual property rights could harm our business. ployees or agents could damage our reputation in the U.S. and internationally or lead to litigation or legal proceedings that could result in civil or criminal penalties, including substantial monetary fines as well as disgorgement of profits .
 Changes in applicable laws or regulations or evolving interpretations thereof, changes in enforcement priorities of regulators, and differing or competing regulations and standards across the markets where our products or raw materials are made, manufactured, distributed or sold . Increased or additional regulations to limit and/or report carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gas emissions as a result of concern over climate change have in the past resulted in, and could continue to result in, higher compliance costs, higher capital expenditures and higher production costs .
 Legal and regulatory landscape for certain new technologies, such as artificial intelligence, is uncertain and evolving . Failure to comply with various laws and regulations (or allegations thereof) could result in litigation or criminal or civil enforcement actions . In 2024, we derived $28.7 billion from sales of our products, which could affect net operating revenues .
 Global events, including political instability, international conflicts, trade disputes, economic sanctions, inflation, increasing interest rates and emerging market volatility, may cause currencies to fluctuate in relation to the U.S. dollar . If interest rates increase, our net income could be negatively affected . We use derivative financial instruments to reduce our exposure to interest rate fluctuations .
 In assessing our credit strength, credit rating agencies consider our capital structure and financial policies . Credit rating agencies also consider financial information of certain of our major bottling partners . If our credit ratings were to be downgraded, our cost of borrowing could increase . The value of an investment in our Company could be negatively affected . We have established and publicly announced certain long-term growth objectives .
 Default by or failure of one or more of our counterparty financial institutions could cause us to incur significant losses . Risk of counterparty default or failure may be heightened during economic downturns and periods of uncertainty in the financial markets . We may not be able to realize the sales potential and the price and product mix necessary to achieve our long-term growth objectives .
 We have recorded in the past, and may be required to record in the future, significant impairment charges . We use information systems to process financial information and results of internal reporting purposes . If we are unable to protect our information systems against service interruption, our reputation could be damaged, we may suffer financial losses and our reputation may be damaged .
 Information systems are critical to many of the Company’s operating activities, our business may be impacted by system shutdowns, service disruptions or cybersecurity incidents . These incidents may be caused by failures during routine operations, such as system upgrades, or by user errors . Cyberattacks by hackers, criminal groups, nation-state organizations or other threat actors could result in unauthorized or accidental access to or disclosure of material confidential information or regulated personal data .
 Unauthorized or accidental access to, or destruction, loss, alteration, disclosure, falsification or unavailability of, information or unauthorized access to machines and equipment could result in violations of data protection laws and regulations . The Company could also be required to spend significant financial and other resources to remedy the damage caused by a cybersecurity incident or to repair or replace networks and information systems .
 Like most major corporations, the Company’s information systems are a target of attacks . Data protection laws and regulations around the world often require “reasonable,” “appropriate” or “adequate” technical and organizational security measures . There can be no assurance that our security measures will be deemed adequate, appropriate or reasonable .
 In addition to potential fines, we could be subject to mandatory corrective action due to a cybersecurity incident . While we have purchased cybersecurity insurance, there are no assurances that the coverage would be sufficient in type or amount in relation to any incurred losses . As cyberattacks increase in frequency and magnitude, we may be unable to obtain cybersecurity insurance in types and amounts we view as appropriate for our operations .
 Some laws and regulations also impose obligations regarding cross-border data transfers of personal data . Maintaining local data centers in individual countries could increase our operating costs significantly . Our security controls over personal data, the training of employees and vendors on data privacy and data security, and the policies, procedures and practices we have implemented or may implement in the future may not prevent the improper disclosure .
 Unauthorized access to or improper disclosure of personal data in violation of privacy and data protection laws could harm our reputation, cause loss of consumer confidence, subject us to regulatory enforcement actions (including penalties, fines and investigations) Increased regulation of data collection, use, disclosure and retention practices, including self-regulation and industry standards, could increase our cost of compliance and operation .
 If we are unable to meet our goals, or if we are perceived to have not responded appropriately to the growing concern for sustainability issues, our reputation, and therefore our ability to sell products, could be negatively impacted . There also exists “anti-ESG” sentiment among certain stakeholders and government entities, which may result in scrutiny .
 There are increasing concerns among certain consumers, governments and other stakeholders about the damaging impact of the accumulation of plastic bottles and other packaging materials in the environment . If we and our bottling partners do not, or are perceived not, to pursue or fulfill our sustainability goals and aspirations, could increase the risk of litigation or result in regulatory actions .
 Coca-Cola: If we don't address plastic materials recoverability and recycling concerns, our corporate image and brand reputation could be damaged . We have also taken and continue to take actions to expand our use of reusable packaging . Tariffs and trade policies may impact the availability and cost of alternative packaging materials, leading us to rely more on plastic packaging than desired .
 Water is a limited resource in many parts of the world, facing unprecedented challenges from overexploitation, increasing demand for food and other consumer and industrial products whose manufacturing processes require water . Water scarcity and poor quality could negatively impact the Coca-Cola system’s costs and capacity . As the demand for wa. ase in recycling rates and/or recycled content minimums, the Company may continue to incur additional expenses .
 The Coca-Cola system may incur higher costs or face capacity constraints and the possibility of reputational damage, which could adversely affect our profitability . Increased demand for food products, decreased agricultural productivity and increased regulation of ingredient sourcing due diligence may negatively affect our business . If we are unable to implement programs focused on economic opportunity and environmental sustainability to address these agricultural challenges .
 There is increasing concern that a gradual increase in global average temperatures due to increased concentration of carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases in the atmosphere is causing significant changes in weather patterns around the globe . Climate change may also exacerbate extreme weather, resulting in water scarcity or flooding, and cause a further deterioration of water quality in affected regions, which could limit water availability for the Coca-Cola system's bottling operations .
 s to address climate change could have a long-term adverse impact on our business and results of operations . The sales of our products are influenced to some extent by weather conditions in the markets in which we operate . Unusually cold or rainy weather during the summer months may have a temporary effect on the demand for our products and contribute to lower sales .
 Our cybersecurity risk management program is integrated into our broader Enterprise Risk Management program . This integrated approach helps ensure cyber risks are not viewed in isolation, but are assessed, prioritized and managed in alignment with the Company’s operational, financial and strategic risks . Our practices are generally developed from, and benchmarked against, recognized cybersecurity frameworks such as the National Institute of Standards and Technology Cybersecurity Framework .
 We do not believe that there are currently any cybersecurity risks associated with third parties . We conduct tests that help discover potential vulnerabilities, including external penetration testing and tabletop and other exercises, to evaluate our core information systems and cybersecurity practices that enable improved decision-making and prioritization . As part of our overall risk mitigation strategy, the Company also maintains cybersecurity insurance coverage .
 We have been the target of cyberattacks and expect them to continue as cybersecurity threats have been rapidly evolving in sophistication and becoming more prevalent in the industry . We cannot eliminate all risks from cybersecurity threats or provide assurances that we have not experienced an undetected cybersecurity incident in the past or that we will not experience such an incident .
